summary: An email chain from August 2020 forwarding a message from Richard Curtiss, a former inmate, who claims to have information about why cameras are turned off in federal prisons and how inmates are killed, specifically referencing Jeffrey Epstein's death. The chain includes responses from various agencies and shows Curtiss's history of contacting authorities.

keyFacts: Richard Curtiss, a former inmate, claims to have specific knowledge about why guards turn off cameras in federal prisons and how inmates are killed, information he offered to the FBI regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Curtiss alleges that when prison cameras are turned off, a 'goon squad' uses handheld camcorders to record everything with video and audio.

The document includes a warning allegedly given to Curtiss by another inmate: 'These people will kill you... They will come into your room at night when you're sleeping and beat you over the head with a fire extinguisher and kill you.'

The email chain shows a pattern of Curtiss contacting multiple federal agencies (FBI, USDOJ, BOP, OCME) over several years (2012-2020) with information and complaints, often receiving generic or non-committal responses.
The NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, in a 2019 email, officially states Jeffrey Epstein's cause of death as 'hanging (suicide)' on August 10, 2019.
